basics.name: Neftali Ramos Jimenez
basics.label: Software Engineer with over 5 years of experience
basics.summary: Software development specialist with +5 years of experience, focused on backend and full stack solutions for key sectors such as health, tourism, and automotive. Expertise in technologies like JavaScript, TypeScript, and Python, with a strong focus on optimization and code quality. Passionate about innovation and collaboration in global teams, driving significant improvements in performance and efficiency.

work.name: Wizeline
work.summary: I collaborate with international clients, focusing on the adoption of new technologies and the development of multiple systems. Working in global teams, I contribute in various areas such as Front-end, Back-end, DevOps. I am noted for creating an automation tool that improved the speed of support ticket resolution by 24%, significantly optimizing customer service processes and operational efficiency.

work.name: Kavak
work.summary: As part of the development team, I played a key role in the migration and update of the car logistics system, with special emphasis on the reliability of information, its integrity, and speed. Although initially hired as a Backend Developer, my role expanded to Full Stack tasks, allowing me to significantly contribute in various areas of the project.

work.name: Dirección General de Turismo Cancún
work.summary: I played a key role in creating the tourism page for the state of Quintana Roo from scratch. I stood out in the automation of processes and in the migration of obsolete systems to more advanced technological solutions. My responsibilities included building technical requirements, automating tasks through web scraping with Python, and creating APIs using NodeJS with GraphQL, significantly contributing to the modernization and efficiency of tourist information systems.

work.name: Mi expediente Medico
work.summary: I contributed to the development of comprehensive medical software, standing out for my high productivity in completing tasks. I was part of a team that developed new modules focused on the emergency area, using PHP 7 and JavaScript. I participated in the migration of services from PHP to advanced technologies and mentored new members, as well as engaging in legacy code refactoring, API development with Node.js and TypeScript, contributing to continuous software improvement and team efficiency.

education.area: Engineering in Data and Organizational Intelligence
